table.name: geography_columns
table.viewSql: SELECT current_database() AS f_table_catalog, n.nspname AS f_table_schema, c.relname AS f_table_name, a.attname AS f_geography_column, postgis_typmod_dims(a.atttypmod) AS coord_dimension, postgis_typmod_srid(a.atttypmod) AS srid, postgis_typmod_type(a.atttypmod) AS type FROM pg_class c, pg_attribute a, pg_type t, pg_namespace n WHERE ((t.typname = 'geography'::name) AND (a.attisdropped = false) AND (a.atttypid = t.oid) AND (a.attrelid = c.oid) AND (c.relnamespace = n.oid) AND (c.relkind = ANY (ARRAY['r'::"char", 'v'::"char", 'm'::"char", 'f'::"char", 'p'::"char"])) AND (NOT pg_is_other_temp_schema(c.relnamespace)) AND has_table_privilege(c.oid, 'SELECT'::text));

table.name: geometry_columns
table.viewSql: SELECT (current_database())::character varying(256) AS f_table_catalog, n.nspname AS f_table_schema, c.relname AS f_table_name, a.attname AS f_geometry_column, COALESCE(postgis_typmod_dims(a.atttypmod), sn.ndims, 2) AS coord_dimension, COALESCE(NULLIF(postgis_typmod_srid(a.atttypmod), 0), sr.srid, 0) AS srid, (replace(replace(COALESCE(NULLIF(upper(postgis_typmod_type(a.atttypmod)), 'GEOMETRY'::text), st.type, 'GEOMETRY'::text), 'ZM'::text, ''::text), 'Z'::text, ''::text))::character varying(30) AS type FROM ((((((pg_class c JOIN pg_attribute a ON (((a.attrelid = c.oid) AND (NOT a.attisdropped)))) JOIN pg_namespace n ON ((c.relnamespace = n.oid))) JOIN pg_type t ON ((a.atttypid = t.oid))) LEFT JOIN ( SELECT s.connamespace, s.conrelid, s.conkey, replace(split_part(s.consrc, ''''::text, 2), ')'::text, ''::text) AS type FROM ( SELECT pg_constraint.connamespace, pg_constraint.conrelid, pg_constraint.conkey, pg_get_constraintdef(pg_constraint.oid) AS consrc FROM pg_constraint) s WHERE (s.consrc ~~* '%geometrytype(% = %'::text)) st ON (((st.connamespace = n.oid) AND (st.conrelid = c.oid) AND (a.attnum = ANY (st.conkey))))) LEFT JOIN ( SELECT s.connamespace, s.conrelid, s.conkey, (replace(split_part(s.consrc, ' = '::text, 2), ')'::text, ''::text))::integer AS ndims FROM ( SELECT pg_constraint.connamespace, pg_constraint.conrelid, pg_constraint.conkey, pg_get_constraintdef(pg_constraint.oid) AS consrc FROM pg_constraint) s WHERE (s.consrc ~~* '%ndims(% = %'::text)) sn ON (((sn.connamespace = n.oid) AND (sn.conrelid = c.oid) AND (a.attnum = ANY (sn.conkey))))) LEFT JOIN ( SELECT s.connamespace, s.conrelid, s.conkey, (replace(replace(split_part(s.consrc, ' = '::text, 2), ')'::text, ''::text), '('::text, ''::text))::integer AS srid FROM ( SELECT pg_constraint.connamespace, pg_constraint.conrelid, pg_constraint.conkey, pg_get_constraintdef(pg_constraint.oid) AS consrc FROM pg_constraint) s WHERE (s.consrc ~~* '%srid(% = %'::text)) sr ON (((sr.connamespace = n.oid) AND (sr.conrelid = c.oid) AND (a.attnum = ANY (sr.conkey))))) WHERE ((c.relkind = ANY (ARRAY['r'::"char", 'v'::"char", 'm'::"char", 'f'::"char", 'p'::"char"])) AND (NOT (c.relname = 'raster_columns'::name)) AND (t.typname = 'geometry'::name) AND (NOT pg_is_other_temp_schema(c.relnamespace)) AND has_table_privilege(c.oid, 'SELECT'::text));

table.name: global_Author
table.remarks: Is parent table for `global_RefCore` table. The latter stores reference information for **all compilations**. `global_Author` stores information about *first authors* and is part of OCTOPUS reference system (= OAID).

column.name: AUTH
column.remarks: Is author family name

column.name: ORCID
column.remarks: Is author ORCID (https://orcid.org). Is the preferred external author identifier

column.name: SCOPUSID
column.remarks: Is author Scopus ID (https://www.scopus.com/)

column.name: WSCC_RESID
column.remarks: Is Web of Science author ID (https://www.webofscience.com/wos/author/)

column.name: CREATED_AT
column.remarks: Is record timestamp with timezone based on UTC

column.name: UPDATED_AT
column.remarks: Is timestamp of record update with timezone based on UTC

column.name: AUTH_URL
column.remarks: Is author url

column.name: URL_DATE
column.remarks: Is date of latest author url validation

table.name: global_biomeID
table.remarks: The global_biomeID table stores iconic *biome types* that allow for a coarse characterisation/classifications of sampled sites amongst Earth’s major biogeographic units.

column.name: CREATED_AT
column.remarks: Is record timestamp with timezone based on UTC

column.name: UPDATED_AT
column.remarks: Is timestamp of record update with timezone based on UTC

table.name: global_dbDOI
table.remarks: Is global lookup table that stores information about *OCTOPUS (sub-)compilation versions* in the form of digital object identifiers (= DBDOI)

column.name: CREATED_AT
column.remarks: Is record timestamp with timezone based on UTC

column.name: UPDATED_AT
column.remarks: Is timestamp of record update with timezone based on UTC

table.name: global_GrainSize
table.remarks: Is global parent table for sample tables of compilations dealing with sedimentary grain sizes (`sed_Sample`, `expage_Sample`, `crn_Sample`). `global_GrainSize` stores the *type of material sampled* (= MATERIAL (**CRN denudation, ExpAge**), = SED_MAT (**SahulSed**)).

column.name: CREATED_AT
column.remarks: Is record timestamp with timezone based on UTC

column.name: UPDATED_AT
column.remarks: Is timestamp of record update with timezone based on UTC

table.name: global_ibraID
table.remarks: Is parent table for `global_SiteMaster` table. The latter stores site related information for collection-dependent sample tables. `global_ibraID` stores information about the *location of the site within the relevant bioregion as defined by the Interim Bio-Regionalisation of Australia (IBRA7) framework* (= IBRACODE, IBRAREGION).

column.name: CREATED_AT
column.remarks: Is record timestamp with timezone based on UTC

column.name: UPDATED_AT
column.remarks: Is timestamp of record update with timezone based on UTC

table.name: global_Journal
table.remarks: Is parent table for `global_RefCore` table. The latter stores reference information for **all compilations**. `global_Journal` store information about *journals* and is part of OCTOPUS reference system (= JOURNALID).

column.name: CREATED_AT
column.remarks: Is record timestamp with timezone based on UTC

column.name: UPDATED_AT
column.remarks: Is timestamp of record update with timezone based on UTC

table.name: global_MetaSite
table.remarks: Is global master table that stores *metasite-related information for all compilations*. In OCTOPUS data model hierarchy `global_MetaSite` is superordinate to `global_SiteMaster`, `<collection name>_Sample`, and `<sub-collection name>_DataCore` tables (in this decreasing order). However, whilst the latter three levels can't be 'NULL', "METASITE" is quasi nullable (= METASITE).

column.name: META_WKT
column.remarks: Reserved for spatial extent of METASITE expressed as WKT polygon (well known text).

column.name: META_AREA
column.remarks: Is METASITE AREA (in square kilometers, 2 digits precision)

column.name: META_COMMT
column.remarks: Freestyle text METASITE comment field

column.name: CREATED_AT
column.remarks: Is record timestamp with timezone based on UTC

column.name: UPDATED_AT
column.remarks: Is timestamp of record update with timezone based on UTC

table.name: global_PubType
table.remarks: Is parent table for `global_RefCore` table. The latter stores reference information for **all compilations**. `global_PubType` stores *publication types* and is part of OCTOPUS reference system (= PUBTYPEID).

column.name: CREATED_AT
column.remarks: Is record timestamp with timezone based on UTC

column.name: UPDATED_AT
column.remarks: Is timestamp of record update with timezone based on UTC

table.name: global_RefAbstract
table.remarks: Is parent table for `global_RefCore` table. The latter stores reference information for **all compilations**. `global_RefAbstract` stores *publication abstracts* and is part of OCTOPUS reference system (= REFDBID; one to one).

column.name: CREATED_AT
column.remarks: Is record timestamp with timezone based on UTC

column.name: UPDATED_AT
column.remarks: Is timestamp of record update with timezone based on UTC

table.name: global_RefCore
table.remarks: Is OCTOPUS DB reference core table, i.e., global lookup table for references. `global_RefCore` stores all relevant reference information, which are linked via "REFDBID" field to compilation DataCore tables (= REFDBID).

column.name: CREATED_AT
column.remarks: Is record timestamp with timezone based on UTC

column.name: UPDATED_AT
column.remarks: Is timestamp of record update with timezone based on UTC

table.name: global_RefKeyword
table.remarks: Is parent table for `global_RefCore` table. The latter stores reference information for **all compilations**. `global_RefKeyword` is thoroughly boolean, stores *compilation membership keywords* for observations and is part of OCTOPUS reference system (= REFDBID; one to one).

column.name: CREATED_AT
column.remarks: Is record timestamp with timezone based on UTC

column.name: UPDATED_AT
column.remarks: Is timestamp of record update with timezone based on UTC

table.name: global_rivID
table.remarks: Is parent table for `global_SiteMaster` table. The latter stores site related information for collection-dependent sample tables. `global_rivID` stores information about the *Geofabric AHGF river region membership* of a certain site (= AHGFL1, AHGFL2, RIVDIV).

column.name: CREATED_AT
column.remarks: Is record timestamp with timezone based on UTC

column.name: UPDATED_AT
column.remarks: Is timestamp of record update with timezone based on UTC

table.name: global_SiteCode
table.remarks: Is lookup table for `global_SiteMaster` table. `global_SiteCode` stores information about the *site type characterising the dominant attribute of the sites*, an information category that is related to **SahulArch** compilations only (= SITECODE).

column.name: CREATED_AT
column.remarks: Is record timestamp with timezone based on UTC

column.name: UPDATED_AT
column.remarks: Is timestamp of record update with timezone based on UTC

table.name: global_SiteMaster
table.remarks: Is the global master table that stores *site-related information for all compilations*. In OCTOPUS data model hierarchy `global_SiteMaster` is situated between the collection-specific sample tables (subordinate) and the `global_MetaSite` table (superordinate); (= SITEID).

column.name: CREATED_AT
column.remarks: Is record timestamp with timezone based on UTC

column.name: UPDATED_AT
column.remarks: Is timestamp of record update with timezone based on UTC

column.name: NEO_SITEID
column.remarks: Is the corresponding neotoma/IPPD site ID, if applicable

table.name: global_UnitMaster
table.remarks: Is the global master table that stores *collection-unit related information for all compilations*. Collection units are defined in the `cabah_unittypeID` table. In OCTOPUS data model hierarchy `global_UnitMaster` is situated between the collection-specific sample tables (subordinate) and the `global_SiteMaster` table (superordinate); (= SITEID). `global_UnitMaster` table is exclusively used for collections with a corresponding demand, i.e., will be bypassed for any collection that does not deal with multiple samples / observations from one and the same location / site / unit (e.g. a core).

column.name: UNIT_COMMT
column.remarks: Is neotoma unit handle (if available)

column.name: CREATED_AT
column.remarks: Is record timestamp with timezone based on UTC

column.name: UPDATED_AT
column.remarks: Is timestamp of record update with timezone based on UTC

column.name: COLL_SPEC
column.remarks: Stores collection process specifics (if applicable)

column.name: UNIT_DESCR
column.remarks: Stores collection-unit related specifics (if applicable)

table.name: global_varunitID
table.remarks: The global_varunitID table stores *variable units* for those compilations whose values involve different units of measurement.

column.name: CREATED_AT
column.remarks: Is record timestamp with timezone based on UTC

column.name: UPDATED_AT
column.remarks: Is timestamp of record update with timezone based on UTC

table.name: osl-tl_agemodelID
table.remarks: Is Luminescence (**SahulSed, SahulArch/ OSL collection, SahulArch/ TL collection**) lookup table for the *model used to combine individual equivalent dose estimates for age determination* (= AGEMODEL)

column.name: CREATED_AT
column.remarks: Is record timestamp with timezone based on UTC

column.name: UPDATED_AT
column.remarks: Is timestamp of record update with timezone based on UTC

table.name: osl-tl_ed_procID
table.remarks: Is Luminescence (**SahulSed, SahulArch/ OSL collection, SahulArch/ TL collection**) lookup table for the *reported procedure used to determine sample equivalent dose for OSL and TL methods* (= ED_PROC)

column.name: CREATED_AT
column.remarks: Is record timestamp with timezone based on UTC

column.name: UPDATED_AT
column.remarks: Is timestamp of record update with timezone based on UTC

table.name: osl-tl_lum_matID
table.remarks: Is Luminescence (**SahulSed, SahulArch/ OSL collection, SahulArch/ TL collection**) lookup table for the *type of sample material used for OSL and TL dating* (= LUM_MAT)

column.name: CREATED_AT
column.remarks: Is record timestamp with timezone based on UTC

column.name: UPDATED_AT
column.remarks: Is timestamp of record update with timezone based on UTC

table.name: osl-tl_mineralID
table.remarks: Is Luminescence (**SahulSed, SahulArch/ OSL collection, SahulArch/ TL collection**) lookup table for the *type of mineral used for equivalent dose determination* (= MINERAL)

column.name: CREATED_AT
column.remarks: Is record timestamp with timezone based on UTC

column.name: UPDATED_AT
column.remarks: Is timestamp of record update with timezone based on UTC

table.name: osl-tl_mtdID
table.remarks: Is Luminescence (**SahulSed, SahulArch/ OSL collection, SahulArch/ TL collection**) lookup table for the *method used to determine a certain element concentration of the sample* (= U_MTD, U_TH_MTD, TH_MTD, K_MTD) resp. the *method used to determine an external dose rate* (= ALPH_MTD, BETA_MTD, GAMMA_MTD)

column.name: CREATED_AT
column.remarks: Is record timestamp with timezone based on UTC

column.name: UPDATED_AT
column.remarks: Is timestamp of record update with timezone based on UTC

table.name: osl_typeID
table.remarks: Is OSL table lookup (**SahulSed/ OSL collections, SahulArch/ OSL collection**) for the *published OSL type used to determine equivalent dose* (= OSL_TYPE)

column.name: CREATED_AT
column.remarks: Is record timestamp with timezone based on UTC

table.name: sed-osl_DataCore
table.remarks: Is Sahul Sedimentary Archives (SahulSed) data table. This table stores *observations* (= smallest data model entity) for the **SahulSed/ OSL collections** and is subordinate to the `arch_Sample` table. Note - This table is further split into Aeolian, Fluvial, and Lacustrine sub-collections.
